narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Everything is so great.

Professor is a good lecturer that discusses a broad range of topics related to design and computer science, lectures are provocative. Could be improved by being more organized in terms of assignments.
Strengths: Good assignments that help facilitate learning. Weaknesses: Grading was based on subjective feelings.
Good
This course is good so far.

pro: beautiful
con:no coding
Off topic
Really chill, low workload class. Lectures are fun and listening to Prof. Gelernter is really cool.
Only strengths. Professor Gelernter is a great lecturer and the assignments were fun and engaging.
We are exposed to a lot of artistic ideas.

The professor needs to spend more time talking about websites and design principles rather than about chairs, architecture, and history. He should give more useful assignments, such as the 2 home page redesign assignments given towards the end of the year. I also would have liked to get feedback on the 4th assignment so I knew how to improve for 5th (final) assignment, but there was nothing to go off of, so final grades are pretty up in the air as a result. It may be an easy, low workload class but be aware of the fact that you may not know how you are doing in the class until you get your final grade.
It seemed off topic in some cases
It's a very good course.

Strength: the content is diverse
Weajness: Disorganized

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes
I would. Professor Gelernter is a fantastic thinker and intellectual.
I would not recommend this course to another student if she/he is serious about user interface.
Yes
Yes. It is an interesting course.

yes
if you want to be product manager u should take
No
Yes, great chill CS class.

Yes, I would recommend it. Professor Gelernter is a very interesting lecturer and the assignments are both fun and engaging. It wont be similar to any other class youve taken, but thats what makes it a gem!

If you actually want to learn about the title of the course, definitely not. If you want an easy CS elective, then sure. Despite not being a fulfilling course, I appreciated it for being an easy CS course. The homework assignments were a fun change of pace even though I found most of them to be a waste of time (other than the last 2 that were actually related to user interface). You could get away with not going to class for the most part, but he does hand out assignments and announce quizzes solely in class, so I attended most classes so I wouldnt miss those. In class you can just do other homework and be fine. So, I recommend it if you just want an easy class and are okay with not learning anything. Just be aware that your grade will be kind of up in the air at the end due to the lack of grades and feedback for the last 2 assignments.
I would recommend this course to someone looking to learn more about UI and design
Yes it's a great course
